register.name: ACTLR_EL2
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for EL2.

register.name: AFSR0_EL2
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for exceptions taken to EL2.

register.name: AFSR1_EL2
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for exceptions taken to EL2.

register.name: AMAIR_EL2
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED memory attributes for the memory regions specified by MAIR_EL2.

register.name: CNTHCTL_EL2
register.description: Controls the generation of an event stream from the physical counter, and access from Non-secure EL1 to the physical counter and the Non-secure EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: EVNTI
bitField.description: Selects which bit (0 to 15) of the counter register CNTPCT_EL0 is the trigger for the event stream generated from that counter, when that stream is enabled.

bitField.name: EVNTDIR
bitField.description: Controls which transition of the counter register CNTPCT_EL0 trigger bit, defined by EVNTI, generates an event when the event stream is enabled:

bitField.name: EVNTEN
bitField.description: Enables the generation of an event stream from the counter register CNTPCT_EL0:

register.name: CNTHP_CTL_EL2
register.gui_name: Counter-timer Hypervisor Physical Timer Control register
register.description: Control register for the EL2 physical timer.

bitField.name: ISTATUS
bitField.description: The status of the timer.

bitField.name: IMASK
bitField.description: Timer interrupt mask bit.

bitField.name: ENABLE
bitField.description: Enables the timer.

register.name: CNTHP_CVAL_EL2
register.gui_name: Counter-timer Hypervisor Physical Timer CompareValue register
register.description: Holds the compare value for the EL2 physical timer.

bitField.name: CompareValue
bitField.description: Holds the EL2 physical timer CompareValue.

register.name: CNTHP_TVAL_EL2
register.gui_name: Counter-timer Hypervisor Physical Timer TimerValue register
register.description: Holds the timer value for the EL2 physical timer.

bitField.name: TimerValue
bitField.description: The TimerValue view of the EL2 physical timer.

register.name: CNTVOFF_EL2
register.description: Holds the 64-bit virtual offset. This is the offset between the physical count value visible in CNTPCT_EL0 and the virtual count value visible in CNTVCT_EL0.

register.name: CPTR_EL2
register.description: Controls...

register.name: ESR_EL2
register.description: Holds syndrome information for an exception taken to EL2.

bitField.name: EC
bitField.description: Exception Class. Indicates the reason for the exception that this register holds information about.

bitField.name: IL
bitField.description: Instruction Length for synchronous exceptions.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction. This field is valid only for exceptions taken from AArch32, and only when the value of CV is 1.

bitField.name: TI
bitField.description: Trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction. This field is valid only for exceptions taken from AArch32, and only when the value of CV is 1.

bitField.name: Opc2
bitField.description: The Opc2 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Opc1
bitField.description: The Opc1 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: CRn
bitField.description: The CRn value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rt
bitField.description: The Rt value from the issued instruction, the general-purpose register used for the transfer. The reported value gives the AArch64 view of the register. See .

bitField.name: CRm
bitField.description: The CRm value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction. This field is valid only for exceptions taken from AArch32, and only when the value of CV is 1.

bitField.name: Opc1
bitField.description: The Opc1 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rt2
bitField.description: The Rt2 value from the issued instruction, the second general-purpose register used for the transfer. The reported value gives the AArch64 view of the register. See .

bitField.name: Rt
bitField.description: The Rt value from the issued instruction, the first general-purpose register used for the transfer. The reported value gives the AArch64 view of the register. See .

bitField.name: CRm
bitField.description: The CRm value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction. This field is valid only for exceptions taken from AArch32, and only when the value of CV is 1.

bitField.name: imm8
bitField.description: The immediate value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rn
bitField.description: The Rn value from the issued instruction, the general-purpose register used for the transfer. The reported value gives the AArch64 view of the register. See .

bitField.name: Offset
bitField.description: Indicates whether the offset is added or subtracted:

bitField.name: AM
bitField.description: Addressing mode.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction. This field is valid only for exceptions taken from AArch32, and only when the value of CV is 1.

bitField.name: imm16
bitField.description: The value of the immediate field from the HVC or SVC instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction. This field is valid only for exceptions taken from AArch32, and only when the value of CV is 1.

bitField.name: CCKNOWNPASS
bitField.description: Indicates whether the instruction might have failed its condition code check.

bitField.name: imm16
bitField.description: The value of the immediate field from the issued SMC instruction.

bitField.name: Op0
bitField.description: The Op0 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Op2
bitField.description: The Op2 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Op1
bitField.description: The Op1 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: CRn
bitField.description: The CRn value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rt
bitField.description: The Rt value from the issued instruction, the general-purpose register used for the transfer.

bitField.name: CRm
bitField.description: The CRm value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: SET
bitField.description: Synchronous Error Type. When the RAS Extension is implemented and IFSC is 010000, describes the state of the PE after taking the Instruction Abort exception.

bitField.name: FnV
bitField.description: FAR not Valid, for a Synchronous external abort other than a Synchronous external abort on a translation table walk.

bitField.name: EA
bitField.description: External abort type. This bit can provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of External aborts.

bitField.name: S1PTW
bitField.description: For a stage 2 fault, indicates whether the fault was a stage 2 fault on an access made for a stage 1 translation table walk:

bitField.name: IFSC
bitField.description: Instruction Fault Status Code.

bitField.name: ISV
bitField.description: Instruction syndrome valid. Indicates whether the syndrome information in ISS[23:14] is valid.

bitField.name: SAS
bitField.description: Syndrome Access Size. When ISV is 1, indicates the size of the access attempted by the faulting operation.

bitField.name: SSE
bitField.description: Syndrome Sign Extend. When ISV is 1, for a byte, halfword, or word load operation, indicates whether the data item must be sign extended.

bitField.name: SRT
bitField.description: Syndrome Register transfer. When ISV is 1, the register number of the Rt operand of the faulting instruction. If the exception was taken from an Exception level that is using AArch32 then this is the AArch64 view of the register. See .

bitField.name: SF
bitField.description: Width of the register accessed by the instruction is Sixty-Four.

bitField.name: AR
bitField.description: Acquire/Release.

bitField.name: SET
bitField.description: Synchronous Error Type. When the RAS Extension is implemented and DFSC is 010000, describes the state of the PE after taking the Data Abort exception.

bitField.name: FnV
bitField.description: FAR not Valid, for a Synchronous external abort other than a Synchronous external abort on a translation table walk.

bitField.name: EA
bitField.description: External abort type. This bit can provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of External aborts.

bitField.name: CM
bitField.description: Cache maintenance.

bitField.name: S1PTW
bitField.description: For a stage 2 fault, indicates whether the fault was a stage 2 fault on an access made for a stage 1 translation table walk:

bitField.name: WnR
bitField.description: Write not Read. Indicates whether a synchronous abort was caused by an instruction writing to a memory location, or by an instruction reading from a memory location.

bitField.name: DFSC
bitField.description: Data Fault Status Code.

bitField.name: TFV
bitField.description: Trapped Fault Valid bit. Indicates whether the IDF, IXF, UFF, OFF, DZF, and IOF bits hold valid information about trapped floating-point exceptions.

bitField.name: VECITR
bitField.description: For a trapped floating-point exception from an instruction executed in AArch32 state this field is RES1.

bitField.name: IDF
bitField.description: Input Denormal floating-point exception trapped bit. If the TFV field is 0, this bit is UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: IXF
bitField.description: Inexact floating-point exception trapped bit. If the TFV field is 0, this bit is UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: UFF
bitField.description: Underflow floating-point exception trapped bit. If the TFV field is 0, this bit is UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: OFF
bitField.description: Overflow floating-point exception trapped bit. If the TFV field is 0, this bit is UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: DZF
bitField.description: Divide by Zero floating-point exception trapped bit. If the TFV field is 0, this bit is UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: IOF
bitField.description: Invalid Operation floating-point exception trapped bit. If the TFV field is 0, this bit is UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: IDS
bitField.description: IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED syndrome.

bitField.name: IESB
bitField.description: Reserved, RES0

bitField.name: EA
bitField.description: External abort type. When the RAS Extension is implemented, this bit can provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of External aborts.

bitField.name: DFSC
bitField.description: Data Fault Status Code.

bitField.name: IFSC
bitField.description: Instruction Fault Status Code. This field is set to 0b100010, to indicate a Debug exception.

bitField.name: ISV
bitField.description: Instruction syndrome valid.

bitField.name: EX
bitField.description: Exclusive operation. If the ISV bit is set to 1, this bit indicates whether a Load-Exclusive instruction was stepped.

bitField.name: IFSC
bitField.description: Instruction Fault Status Code. This field is set to 0b100010, to indicate a Debug exception.

bitField.name: CM
bitField.description: Cache maintenance.

bitField.name: WnR
bitField.description: Write not Read. Indicates whether the abort was caused by an instruction writing to a memory location, or by an instruction reading from a memory location.

bitField.name: DFSC
bitField.description: Data Fault Status Code. This field is set to 0b100010, to indicate a Debug exception.

bitField.name: Comment
bitField.description: Set to the instruction comment field value, zero extended as necessary. For the AArch32 BKPT instructions, the comment field is described as the immediate field.

register.name: FAR_EL2
register.description: Holds the faulting Virtual Address for all synchronous Instruction or Data Abort, PC alignment fault and Watchpoint exceptions that are taken to EL2.

register.name: HACR_EL2
register.description: Controls trapping to EL2 of IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED aspects of Non-secure EL1 or EL0 operation.

register.name: HCR_EL2
register.description: Provides configuration controls for virtualization, including defining whether various Non-secure operations are trapped to EL2.

bitField.name: MIOCNCE
bitField.description: Mismatched Inner/Outer Cacheable Non-Coherency Enable, for the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: TEA
bitField.description: Route synchronous External Abort exceptions to EL2.

bitField.name: TERR
bitField.description: Trap Error record accesses.

bitField.name: TLOR
bitField.description: Trap LOR registers. Traps accesses to the LORSA_EL1, LOREA_EL1, LORN_EL1, LORC_EL1, and LORID_EL1 registers from Non-secure EL1 to EL2.

bitField.name: E2H
bitField.description: EL2 Host. Enables a configuration where a Host Operating System is running in EL2, and the Host Operating System's applications are running in EL0.

bitField.name: ID
bitField.description: Stage 2 Instruction access cacheability disable. For the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime, when HCR_EL2.VM==1, this control forces all stage 2 translations for instruction accesses to Normal memory to be Non-cacheable.

bitField.name: CD
bitField.description: Stage 2 Data access cacheability disable. For the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime, when HCR_EL2.VM==1, this control forces all stage 2 translations for data accesses and translation table walks to Normal memory to be Non-cacheable.

bitField.name: RW
bitField.description: Execution state control for lower Exception levels:

bitField.name: TRVM
bitField.description: Trap Reads of Virtual Memory controls. Traps Non-secure EL1 reads of the virtual memory control registers to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: HCD
bitField.description: HVC instruction disable. Disables Non-secure state execution of HVC instructions, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TDZ
bitField.description: Trap DC ZVA instructions. Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 execution of DC ZVA instructions to EL2, from AArch64 state only.

bitField.name: TGE
bitField.description: Trap General Exceptions, from Non-secure EL0.

bitField.name: TVM
bitField.description: Trap Virtual Memory controls. Traps Non-secure EL1 writes to the virtual memory control registers to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TTLB
bitField.description: Trap TLB maintenance instructions. Traps Non-secure EL1 execution of TLB maintenance instructions to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TPU
bitField.description: Trap cache maintenance instructions that operate to the Point of Unification. Traps execution of those cache maintenance instructions at Non-secure EL1 or EL0 using AArch64, and at Non-secure EL1 using AArch32, to EL2.

bitField.name: TPC
bitField.description: Trap data or unified cache maintenance instructions that operate to the Point of Coherency. Traps execution of those cache maintenance instructions at Non-secure EL1 or EL0 using AArch64, and at Non-secure EL1 using AArch32, to EL2.

bitField.name: TSW
bitField.description: Trap data or unified cache maintenance instructions that operate by Set/Way. Traps execution of those cache maintenance instructions at Non-secure EL1 using AArch64, and at Non-secure EL1 using AArch32, to EL2.

bitField.name: TACR
bitField.description: Trap Auxiliary Control Registers. Traps Non-secure EL1 accesses to the Auxiliary Control Registers to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TIDCP
bitField.description: Trap IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED functionality. Traps Non-secure EL1 accesses to the encodings reserved for IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED functionality to EL2.

bitField.name: TSC
bitField.description: Trap SMC instructions. Traps Non-secure EL1 execution of SMC instructions to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TID3
bitField.description: Trap ID group 3.

bitField.name: TID2
bitField.description: Trap ID group 2.

bitField.name: TID1
bitField.description: Trap ID group 1.

bitField.name: TID0
bitField.description: Trap ID group 0.

bitField.name: TWE
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 execution of WFE instructions to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TWI
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 execution of WFI instructions to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: DC
bitField.description: This field is permitted to be cached in a TLB.

bitField.name: BSU
bitField.description: Barrier Shareability upgrade.

bitField.name: FB
bitField.description: Force broadcast.

bitField.name: VSE
bitField.description: Virtual SError interrupt.

bitField.name: VI
bitField.description: Virtual IRQ Interrupt.

bitField.name: VF
bitField.description: Virtual FIQ Interrupt.

bitField.name: AMO
bitField.description: Physical SError Interrupt routing.

bitField.name: IMO
bitField.description: Physical IRQ Routing.

bitField.name: FMO
bitField.description: Physical FIQ Routing.

bitField.name: PTW
bitField.description: Protected Table Walk. In the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime, a translation table access made as part of a stage 1 translation table walk is subject to a stage 2 translation. The combining of the memory type attributes from the two stages of translation means the access might be made to a type of Device memory.

bitField.name: SWIO
bitField.description: Set/Way Invalidation Override.

bitField.name: VM
bitField.description: Virtualization enable. Enables stage 2 address translation for the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime.

register.name: HPFAR_EL2
register.description: Holds the faulting IPA for some aborts on a stage 2 translation taken to EL2.

bitField.name: FIPA_47_12
bitField.description: Bits [47:12] of the faulting intermediate physical address. For implementations with fewer than 48 physical address bits, the corresponding upper bits in this field are RES0.

register.name: HSTR_EL2
register.description: Controls trapping to Hyp mode of Non-secure accesses, at EL1 or lower in AArch32, to the System register in the coproc == 1111 encoding space, by the CRn value used to access the register using MCR or MRC instruction. When the register is accessible using an MCRR or MRRC instruction, this is the CRm value used to access the register.

bitField.description: Fields T14 and T4 are RES0.

bitField.description: Fields T14 and T4 are RES0.

register.name: ICC_SRE_EL2
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller System Register Enable register (EL2)
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL2.

bitField.name: Enable

bitField.name: DIB
bitField.description: Disable IRQ bypass.

bitField.name: DFB

bitField.name: SRE
bitField.description: System Register Enable.

register.name: ICH_HCR_EL2
register.description: Controls the environment for VMs.

bitField.name: EOIcount
bitField.description: This field is incremented whenever a successful write to a virtual EOIR or DIR register would have resulted in a virtual interrupt deactivation.

bitField.name: TDIR
bitField.description: Trap Non-secure EL1 writes to ICC_DIR_EL1 and ICV_DIR_EL1.

bitField.name: TSEI
bitField.description: Trap all locally generated SEIs. This bit allows the hypervisor to intercept locally generated SEIs that would otherwise be taken at Non-secure EL1.

bitField.name: TALL1
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* and ICV_* System registers for Group 1 interrupts to EL2.

bitField.name: TALL0
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* and ICV_* System registers for Group 0 interrupts to EL2.

bitField.name: TC
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to System registers that are common to Group 0 and Group 1 to EL2.

bitField.name: VGrp1DIE
bitField.description: VM Group 1 Disabled Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: VGrp1EIE
bitField.description: VM Group 1 Enabled Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: VGrp0DIE
bitField.description: VM Group 0 Disabled Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: VGrp0EIE
bitField.description: VM Group 0 Enabled Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: NPIE
bitField.description: No Pending Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: LRENPIE
bitField.description: List Register Entry Not Present Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: UIE
bitField.description: Underflow Interrupt Enable.

bitField.name: En
bitField.description: Enable.

register.name: ICH_LR0_EL2
register.description: Provides interrupt context information for the virtual CPU interface.

bitField.name: State
bitField.description: The state of the interrupt:

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the ID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: Priority
bitField.description: The priority of this interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical INTID, for hardware interrupts.

bitField.name: vINTID
bitField.description: Virtual INTID of the interrupt.

bitField.name: State
bitField.description: The state of the interrupt:

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the ID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: Priority
bitField.description: The priority of this interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical INTID, for hardware interrupts.

bitField.name: vINTID
bitField.description: Virtual INTID of the interrupt.

bitField.name: VGrp0D
bitField.description: vPE Group 0 Disabled.

bitField.name: VGrp0E

bitField.name: EOI

register.name: ICH_VMCR_EL2
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Machine Control Register
register.description: Enables the hypervisor to save and restore the virtual machine view of the GIC state.

bitField.name: VPMR
bitField.description: Virtual Priority Mask. The priority mask level for the virtual CPU interface. If the priority of a pending virtual interrupt is higher than the value indicated by this field, the interface signals the virtual interrupt to the PE.

bitField.name: VBPR0
bitField.description: Virtual Binary Point Register, Group 0. Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 0 interrupt preemption, and also determines Group 1 interrupt preemption if ICH_VMCR_EL2.VCBPR == 1.

bitField.name: VBPR1
bitField.description: Virtual Binary Point Register, Group 1. Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 1 interrupt preemption if ICH_VMCR_EL2.VCBPR == 0.

bitField.name: VEOIM
bitField.description: Virtual EOI mode.

bitField.name: VCBPR
bitField.description: Virtual Common Binary Point Register.

bitField.name: VFIQEn
bitField.description: Virtual FIQ enable.

bitField.name: VAckCtl
bitField.description: Virtual AckCtl.

bitField.name: VENG1
bitField.description: Virtual Group 1 interrupt enable.

bitField.name: VENG0
bitField.description: Virtual Group 0 interrupt enable.

register.name: ICH_VTR_EL2
register.description: Reports supported GIC virtualisartion features.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. The number of virtual priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: PREbits
bitField.description: The number of virtual preemption bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: The number of virtual interrupt identifier bits supported:

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid.

bitField.name: nV4
bitField.description: Direct injection of virtual interrupts not supported.

bitField.name: TDS
bitField.description: Separate trapping of Non-secure EL1 writes to ICV_DIR_EL1 supported.

bitField.name: ListRegs
bitField.description: The number of implemented List registers, minus one. For example, a value of 0b01111 indicates that the maximum of 16 List registers are implemented.

register.name: MAIR_EL2
register.description: Provides the memory attribute encodings corresponding to the possible AttrIndx values in a Long-descriptor format translation table entry for stage 1 translations at EL2.

bitField.name: Attr7
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where AttrIndx[2:0] gives the value of <n> in Attr<n>.

bitField.name: Attr6
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where AttrIndx[2:0] gives the value of <n> in Attr<n>.

bitField.name: Attr5
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where AttrIndx[2:0] gives the value of <n> in Attr<n>.

bitField.name: Attr4
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where AttrIndx[2:0] gives the value of <n> in Attr<n>.

bitField.name: Attr3
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where AttrIndx[2:0] gives the value of <n> in Attr<n>.

bitField.name: Attr2
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where AttrIndx[2:0] gives the value of <n> in Attr<n>.

bitField.name: Attr1
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where AttrIndx[2:0] gives the value of <n> in Attr<n>.

bitField.name: Attr0
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where AttrIndx[2:0] gives the value of <n> in Attr<n>.

register.name: MDCR_EL2
register.description: Provides EL2 configuration options for self-hosted debug and the Performance Monitors Extension.

bitField.name: HPMD
bitField.description: Guest Performance Monitors Disable. This control prohibits event counting at EL2.

bitField.name: TDRA
bitField.description: Trap Debug ROM Address register access. Traps Non-secure System register accesses to the Debug ROM registers to EL2.

bitField.name: TDOSA
bitField.description: Trap debug OS-related register access.

bitField.name: TDA
bitField.description: Trap Debug Access.

bitField.name: TDE
bitField.description: Trap Debug exceptions.

bitField.name: HPME
bitField.description: Hypervisor Performance Monitors Counters Enable.

bitField.name: TPM
bitField.description: Trap Performance Monitors accesses.

bitField.name: TPMCR
bitField.description: Trap PMCR_EL0 or PMCR accesses. Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 accesses to the PMCR_EL0 or PMCR to EL2.

bitField.name: HPMN
bitField.description: Defines the number of Performance Monitors counters that are accessible from Non-secure EL0 and EL1 modes.

register.name: RMR_EL2
register.description: If EL2 is the highest implemented Exception level and this register is implemented...

bitField.name: RR
bitField.description: Reset Request. Setting this bit to 1 requests a Warm reset.

bitField.name: AA64
bitField.description: When EL2 can use AArch32, determines which Execution state the PE boots into after a Warm reset:

register.name: SCTLR_EL2
register.description: Provides top level control of the system, including its memory system, at EL2...

bitField.name: WXN
bitField.description: Write permission implies XN (Execute-never). For the EL2 or EL2&0 translation regime, this bit can force all memory regions that are writable to be treated as XN.

bitField.name: SA
bitField.description: SP Alignment check enable. When set to 1, if a load or store instruction executed at EL2 uses the SP as the base address and the SP is not aligned to a 16-byte boundary, then a SP alignment fault exception is generated. For more information, see .

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Cacheability control, for data accesses.

bitField.name: A
bitField.description: Alignment check enable.

register.name: TCR_EL2
register.description: The control register for stage 1 of the EL2, or EL2&0, translation regime...

bitField.name: TG0
bitField.description: Granule size for the TTBR0_EL2.

bitField.name: SH0
bitField.description: Shareability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using TTBR0_EL2.

bitField.name: ORGN0
bitField.description: Outer cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using TTBR0_EL2.

bitField.name: IRGN0
bitField.description: Inner cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using TTBR0_EL2.

bitField.name: T0SZ
bitField.description: The size offset of the memory region addressed by TTBR0_EL2. The region size is 2^(64-T0SZ) bytes.

register.name: TPIDR_EL2
register.description: Provides a location where software executing at EL2 can store thread identifying information, for OS management purposes...

register.name: TTBR0_EL2
register.description: When HCR_EL2.E2H is 0, holds the base address of the translation table for the initial lookup for stage 1 of an address translation in the EL2 translation regime, and other information for this translation regime...

bitField.name: ASID
bitField.description: When HCR_EL2.E2H is 0, this field is RES0.

bitField.name: BADDR
bitField.description: Translation table base address, A[47:x] or A[51:x], bits[47:1].

register.name: TTBR1_EL2
register.description: When HCR_EL2.E2H is 1, holds the base address of the translation table for the initial lookup for stage 1 of the translation of an address from the higher VA range in the EL2&0 translation regime, and other information for this translation regime.

bitField.name: ASID
bitField.description: An ASID for the translation table base address. The TCR_EL2.A1 field selects either TTBR0_EL2.ASID or TTBR1_EL2.ASID.

bitField.name: BADDR
bitField.description: Translation table base address, A[47:x] or A[51:x], bits[47:1].

register.name: VBAR_EL2
register.description: Holds the vector base address for any exception that is taken to EL2.

register.name: VMPIDR_EL2
register.description: Holds the value of the Virtualization Multiprocessor ID. This is the value returned by Non-secure EL1 reads of MPIDR_EL1.

bitField.name: Aff3
bitField.description: Affinity level 3. Highest level affinity field.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: Indicates a Uniprocessor system, as distinct from PE 0 in a multiprocessor system.

bitField.name: MT
bitField.description: Indicates whether the lowest level of affinity consists of logical PEs that are implemented using a multithreading type approach.

bitField.name: Aff2
bitField.description: Affinity level 2. Second highest level affinity field.

bitField.name: Aff1
bitField.description: Affinity level 1. Third highest level affinity field.

bitField.name: Aff0
bitField.description: Affinity level 0. Lowest level affinity field.

register.name: VPIDR_EL2
register.description: Holds the value of the Virtualization Processor ID. This is the value returned by Non-secure EL1 reads of MIDR_EL1.

bitField.name: Implementer
bitField.description: The Implementer code. This field must hold an implementer code that has been assigned by ARM.

bitField.name: Variant
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED variant number. Typically, this field is used to distinguish between different product variants, or major revisions of a product.

bitField.name: Architecture
bitField.description: The permitted values of this field are:

bitField.name: PartNum
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED primary part number for the device.

bitField.name: Revision
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED revision number for the device.

register.name: VTCR_EL2
register.description: The control register for stage 2 of the EL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: HD
bitField.description: Hardware management of dirty state in stage 2 translations from Non-secure EL0 and EL1.

bitField.name: HA
bitField.description: Hardware Access flag update in stage 2 translations from Non-secure EL0 and EL1.

bitField.name: VS
bitField.description: VMID Size.

bitField.name: PS
bitField.description: Physical Address Size.

bitField.name: TG0
bitField.description: Granule size for the VTTBR_EL2.

bitField.name: SH0
bitField.description: Shareability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using VTTBR_EL2.

bitField.name: ORGN0
bitField.description: Outer cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using VTTBR_EL2.

bitField.name: IRGN0
bitField.description: Inner cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using VTTBR_EL2.

bitField.name: SL0
bitField.description: Starting level of the VTCR_EL2 addressed region. The meaning of this field depends on the value of VTCR_EL2.TG0 (the granule size).

bitField.name: T0SZ
bitField.description: The size offset of the memory region addressed by VTTBR_EL2. The region size is 2^(64-T0SZ) bytes.

register.name: VTTBR_EL2
register.description: Holds the base address of the translation table for the initial lookup for stage 2 of an address translation in the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime, and other information for this translation regime.

bitField.name: VMID_15_8
bitField.description: Extension to VMID[7:0]. See VMID[7:0] for more details.

bitField.name: VMID_7_0
bitField.description: The VMID for the translation table.

bitField.name: BADDR
bitField.description: Translation table base address, A[47:x] or A[51:x], bits[47:1].
